import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")
source.6d0e494e:
fig = plt.figure(figsize = (15,5))
plt.subplot(1,2,1)
sns.boxplot(y = "YearsExperience", data = train_df, palette="Set3")
plt.subplot(1,2,2)
sns.boxplot(y = "Salary", data = train_df, palette = "Set3")
plt.show()

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
x_train, x_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(train_df, y, test_size = 0.2, random_state = 0)
source.c4b92b5c:
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
lr = LinearRegression()
lr.fit(x_train,y_train)
source.9b3ee2af:
plt.figure(figsize = (20,5))
plt.subplot(1,2,1)
plt.scatter(x_train, y_train, color = 'Grey')
plt.plot(x_train, lr.predict(x_train))
plt.xlabel('Years of Experience')
plt.ylabel('Salary')

plt.subplot(1,2,2)
plt.scatter(x_test,y_test,c = 'Grey', )
plt.plot(x_train, lr.predict(x_train))

plt.xlabel('Years of Experience')
plt.ylabel('Salary')
plt.show()
